ECID.Name: EstablishCommunicationsTimeout
ECID.Description: The length of time, in seconds, of the interval between attempts to send S1F13 when establishing communications.

ECID.Name: TimeFormat
ECID.Description: The setting of this ECV controls whether the equipment shall use use the variable item CLOCK and the data items STIME, TIMESTAMP, and TIME in 12-byte, 16-byte, or Extended format.

DataItem.Name: ABS
DataItem.Description: Any binary string.

DataItem.Name: ACCESSMODE
DataItem.Description: Load Port Access Mode. Possible values are:

DataItem.Name: ACDS
DataItem.Description: After Command Codes.

DataItem.Name: ACKA
DataItem.Description: Indicates success of a request:

DataItem.Name: ACKC3
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ACKC5
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ACKC6
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ACKC7
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ACKC7A
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ACKC10
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ACKC13
DataItem.Description: Return code for secondary messages 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ACKC15
DataItem.Description: Return code for secondary messages, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ALCD
DataItem.Description: Alarm code byte.

DataItem.Name: ALED
DataItem.Description: Alarm enable/disable code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ALID
DataItem.Description: Alarm identification.

DataItem.Name: ALTX
DataItem.Description: Alarm text limited to 120 characters.

DataItem.Name: ATTRDATA
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8, Boolean
DataItem.Description: Contains a specific attribute value for a specific object.

DataItem.Name: ATTRID
DataItem.Description: Identifier for an attribute for a specific type of object.

DataItem.Name: ATTRRELN
DataItem.Description: The relationship that a specified qualifying value has to the value of an attribute of an object instance (the value of interest):

DataItem.Name: AUTOCLEAR
DataItem.Description: A flag which enables or disables the Auto Clear function.

DataItem.Name: AUTOCLOSE
DataItem.Description: A function that equipment closes the session automatically when operator access doesn’t occur exceeding the predefined maximum time.

DataItem.Name: BCDS
DataItem.Description: Before Command Codes.

DataItem.Name: BCEQU
DataItem.Description: Bin code equivalents.

DataItem.Name: BINLT
DataItem.Description: The Bin List.

DataItem.Name: BLKDEF
DataItem.Description: Block Definition.

DataItem.Name: BPD
DataItem.Description: Boot program Data.

DataItem.Name: BYTMAX
DataItem.Description: Byte Maximum.

DataItem.Name: CAACK
DataItem.Description: Carrier Action Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: CARRIERACTION
DataItem.Description: Specifies the action requested for a carrier.

DataItem.Name: CARRIERID
DataItem.Description: The identifier of a carrier.

DataItem.Name: CARRIERSPEC
DataItem.Description: The object specifier for a carrier. Conforms to OBJSPEC.

DataItem.Name: CATTRDATA
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8, Boolean
DataItem.Description: The value of a carrier attribute.

DataItem.Name: CATTRID
DataItem.Description: The name of a carrier attribute.

DataItem.Name: CCACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: CCODE
DataItem.Description: Command Code.

DataItem.Name: CEED
DataItem.Description: Collection event or trace enable/disable code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: CEID
DataItem.Description: Collected event ID.

DataItem.Name: CENAME
DataItem.Description: Collection event name.

DataItem.Name: CEPACK
DataItem.Description: Command Enhanced Parameter Acknowledge.

DataItem.Name: CEPVAL
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Command Enhanced Parameter Value.

DataItem.Name: CHKINFO
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: User defined.

DataItem.Name: CKPNT
DataItem.Description: Checkpoint as defined by the sending system.

DataItem.Name: CLSSTS
DataItem.Description: Information if the session is closed properly.

DataItem.Name: CMDA
DataItem.Description: Command acknowledge code.

DataItem.Name: CMDMAX
DataItem.Description: Command Maximum.

DataItem.Name: CNAME
DataItem.Description: Command Name = 16 characters.

DataItem.Name: COLCT
DataItem.Description: Column count in die increments.

DataItem.Name: COLHDR
DataItem.Description: Text description of contents of TBLELT. 1–20 characters.

DataItem.Name: COMMACK
DataItem.Description: Establish Communications Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: COMPARISONOPERATOR
DataItem.Description: Choice of available operators that compare the supplied value to the current attribute value. Evaluated as ‘Current value XX supplied value’ where XX is one of the enumerated values (e.g., ‘GT’).

DataItem.Name: CONDITION
DataItem.Description: Provides condition information for a subsystem component. Used in the data item in the CONDITIONLIST.

DataItem.Name: CONDITIONLIST
DataItem.Description: A list of CONDITION data sent in a fixed order. CONDITIONLIST has the following form:

DataItem.Name: CPACK
DataItem.Description: Command Parameter Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: CPNAME
DataItem.Description: Command Parameter Name.

DataItem.Name: CPVAL
DataItem.AllowableFormats: B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Command Parameter Value.

DataItem.Name: CRAACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: CRAEACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the event.

DataItem.Name: CSAACK
DataItem.Description: Equipment Acknowledgement code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: CTLJOBCMD
DataItem.Description: Control Job command codes are assigned as follows:

DataItem.Name: CTLJOBID
DataItem.Description: Identifier for Control Job. Conforms to OBJID.

DataItem.Name: DATA
DataItem.Description: A vector or string of unformatted data.

DataItem.Name: DATAACK
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge code for data.

DataItem.Name: DATAID
DataItem.Description: Data ID.

DataItem.Name: DATALENGTH
DataItem.Description: Total bytes to be sent.

DataItem.Name: DATASEG
DataItem.Description: Used to identify the data requested.

DataItem.Name: DATASRC
DataItem.Description: Object type for Data Source Objects.

DataItem.Name: DATLC
DataItem.Description: Data location.

DataItem.Name: DELRSPSTAT
DataItem.Description: Status response for the Delete PDE request.

DataItem.Name: DIRRSPSTAT
DataItem.Description: Status response for the GET PDE Directory request.

DataItem.Name: DRACK
DataItem.Description: Define Report Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: DRRACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: DSID
DataItem.Description: Data set ID.

DataItem.Name: DSNAME
DataItem.Description: The name of the Data Set.

DataItem.Name: DSPER
DataItem.Description: Data sample period. DSPER has two allowable formats:

DataItem.Name: DUTMS
DataItem.Description: Die Units of Measure.

DataItem.Name: DVNAME
DataItem.Description: Data value name.

DataItem.Name: DVVAL
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Data value.

DataItem.Name: DVVALNAME
DataItem.Description: A descriptive name for the data variable.

DataItem.Name: EAC
DataItem.Description: Equipment acknowledge code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ECDEF
DataItem.AllowableFormats: B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Equipment constant default value.

DataItem.Name: ECID
DataItem.Description: Equipment Constant ID.

DataItem.Name: ECMAX
DataItem.AllowableFormats: B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Equipment constant maximum value.

DataItem.Name: ECMIN
DataItem.AllowableFormats: B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Equipment constant minimum value.

DataItem.Name: ECNAME
DataItem.Description: Equipment constant name.

DataItem.Name: ECV
DataItem.AllowableFormats: B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Equipment Constant Value.

DataItem.Name: EDID
DataItem.Description: Expected data Identification.

DataItem.Name: EMID
DataItem.Description: Equivalent material ID (16 bytes maximum).

DataItem.Name: EPD
DataItem.Description: Executive program data.

DataItem.Name: EQID
DataItem.Description: Identifier that indicates equipment which the recipe is tuned for.

DataItem.Name: EQNAME
DataItem.Description: A unique ASCII equipment identifier assigned by the factory to the equipment. Limited to a maximum of 80 characters.

DataItem.Name: ERACK
DataItem.Description: Enable/Disable Event Report. Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: ERCACK
DataItem.Description: Response component for single recipe check.

DataItem.Name: ERRCODE
DataItem.Description: Code identifying an error.

DataItem.Name: ERRTEXT
DataItem.Description: Text string describing the error noted in the corresponding ERRCODE. Limited to 120 characters maximum.

DataItem.Name: ERRW7
DataItem.Description: Text string describing error found in process program.

DataItem.Name: ERXACK
DataItem.Description: Response component for single recipe transfer.

DataItem.Name: EVNTSRC
DataItem.Description: Object type for Event Source Objects.

DataItem.Name: EXID
DataItem.Description: Unique identifier for the exception. Maximum length of 20 characters.

DataItem.Name: EXMESSAGE
DataItem.Description: Text which describes the nature of the exception.

DataItem.Name: EXRECVRA
DataItem.Description: Text which specifies a recovery action for an exception. Maximum length of 40 bytes.

DataItem.Name: EXTYPE
DataItem.Description: Text which identifies the type of an exception. It is usually a single word of text.

DataItem.Name: FCNID
DataItem.Description: Function Identification.

DataItem.Name: FFROT
DataItem.Description: Film Frame Rotation.

DataItem.Name: FILDAT
DataItem.Description: Data from the Data Set.

DataItem.Name: FNLOC
DataItem.Description: Flat/Notch Location.

DataItem.Name: FRMLEN
DataItem.Description: Formatted Process Program Length.

DataItem.Name: GETRSPSTAT
DataItem.Description: Status response for the Get PDE and Get PDEheader requests.

DataItem.Name: GRANT
DataItem.Description: Grant code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: GRANT6
DataItem.Description: Permission to send, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: GRNT1
DataItem.Description: Grant code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: GRXLACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: HANDLE
DataItem.Description: Logical unit or channel.

DataItem.Name: HCACK
DataItem.Description: Host Command Parameter Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: HOACK
DataItem.Description: Conveys whether the corresponding handoff activity succeeded (= True) or failed (= False).

DataItem.Name: HOCANCELACK
DataItem.Description: Tells whether the cancel ready message was accepted or rejected.

DataItem.Name: HOCMDNAME
DataItem.Description: Identifier for the handoff command to be executed.

DataItem.Name: HOHALTACK
DataItem.Description: Tells whether the halt command was accepted or rejected.

DataItem.Name: IACDS
DataItem.Description: Immediately After Command Codes.

DataItem.Name: IBCDS
DataItem.Description: Immediately Before Command Codes.

DataItem.Name: IDTYP
DataItem.Description: Id type.

DataItem.Name: INPTN
DataItem.Description: A specialized version of PTN indicating the InputPort.

DataItem.Name: JOBACTION
DataItem.Description: Specifies the action for a ReticleTransferJob.

DataItem.Name: LENGTH
DataItem.Description: Length of the service program or process program in bytes.

DataItem.Name: LIMITACK
DataItem.Description: Acknowledgment code for variable limit attribute set, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: LIMITID
DataItem.Description: The identifier of a specific limit in the set of limits (as defined by UPPERDB and LOWERDB) for a variable to which the corresponding limit attributes refer, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: LIMITMAX
DataItem.AllowableFormats: Boolean, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: The maximum allowed value for the limit values of a specific variable.

DataItem.Name: LIMITMIN
DataItem.AllowableFormats: Boolean, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: The minimum allowed value for the limit values of a specific variable.

DataItem.Name: LINKID
DataItem.Description: Used to link a completion message with a request that an operation be performed. LINKID is set to the value of RMOPID in the initial request except for the last completion message to be sent, where it is set to zero.

DataItem.Name: LLIM
DataItem.Description: Lower limit for numeric value.

DataItem.Name: LOC
DataItem.Description: Machine material location code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: LOCID
DataItem.Description: The logical identifier of a material location.

DataItem.Name: LOWERDB
DataItem.AllowableFormats: Boolean, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: A variable limit attribute which defines the lower boundary of the deadband of a limit. The value applies to a single limit (LIMITID) for a specified VID. Thus, UPPERDB and LOWERDB as a pair define a limit.

DataItem.Name: LRACK
DataItem.Description: Link Report Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: LVACK
DataItem.Description: Variable limit definition acknowledge code, 1 byte. Defines the error with the limit attributes for the referenceVID.

DataItem.Name: MAPER
DataItem.Description: Map Error.

DataItem.Name: MAPFT
DataItem.Description: Map data format type.

DataItem.Name: MAXNUMBER
DataItem.Description: Provides MaxNumber information for each subspace. Used in the data item MAXNUMBERLIST.

DataItem.Name: MAXNUMBERLIST
DataItem.Description: Maximum number of PEM Recipes allowed to be preserved in PRC after PJ creation. MaxNumber has a list structure so that it can be applied to each subspace. The usage of the list structure is equipment defined.

DataItem.Name: MAXTIME
DataItem.Description: Maximum time during which a PEM Recipe allowed to be in PRC after use.

DataItem.Name: MCINDEX
DataItem.Description: Identifier used to link a handoff command message with its eventual completion message. Corresponding messages carry the same value for this data item.

DataItem.Name: MDACK
DataItem.Description: Map data acknowledge.

DataItem.Name: MDLN
DataItem.Description: Equipment Model Type, 20 bytes max.

DataItem.Name: MEXP
DataItem.Description: Message expected in the form SxxFyy where x is stream and y is function.

DataItem.Name: MF
DataItem.Description: Material format code 1 byte by Format 10.

DataItem.Name: MHEAD
DataItem.Description: SECS message block header associated with message block in error.

DataItem.Name: MID
DataItem.Description: Material ID.

DataItem.Name: MIDAC
DataItem.Description: Material ID Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: MIDRA
DataItem.Description: Material ID Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: MLCL
DataItem.Description: Message length.

DataItem.Name: MMODE
DataItem.Description: Matrix mode select, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: NACDS
DataItem.Description: Not After Command Codes.

DataItem.Name: NBCDS
DataItem.Description: Not Before Command Codes.

DataItem.Name: NULBC
DataItem.Description: Null bin code value.

DataItem.Name: OBJACK
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge code:

DataItem.Name: OBJCMD
DataItem.Description: Specifies an action to be performed by an object:

DataItem.Name: OBJID
DataItem.Description: Identifier for an object.

DataItem.Name: OBJSPEC
DataItem.Description: A text string that has an internal format and that is used to point to a specific object instance. The string is formed out of a sequence of formatted substrings, each specifying an object’s type and identifier. The substring format has the following four fields: object type, colon character ‘:’, object identifier, greater-than symbol ‘>’ where the colon character ‘:’ is used to terminate an object type and the greater than symbol ‘>’ is used to terminate an identifier field. The object type field may be omitted where it may be otherwise determined. The final ‘>’ is optional.

DataItem.Name: OBJTOKEN
DataItem.Description: Token used for authorization.

DataItem.Name: OBJTYPE
DataItem.Description: Identifier for a group or class of objects. All objects of the same type must have the same set of attributes available.

DataItem.Name: OFLACK
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge code for OFF-LINE request.

DataItem.Name: ONLACK
DataItem.Description: Acknowledge code for ONLINE request.

DataItem.Name: OPID
DataItem.Description: Operation ID. A unique integer generated by the requestor of an operation, used where multiple completion confirmations may occur.

DataItem.Name: OPRID
DataItem.Description: Host-registered identifier of the operator who uses the Remote Access session

DataItem.Name: OPRPWORD
DataItem.Description: Host-registered password of the operator who uses the Remote Access session.

DataItem.Name: ORAACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: ORAEACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the event.

DataItem.Name: ORLOC
DataItem.Description: Origin Location.

DataItem.Name: OUTPTN
DataItem.Description: A specialized version of PTN indicating the OutPutPort.

DataItem.Name: PARAMNAME
DataItem.Description: The name of a parameter in a request.

DataItem.Name: PARAMVAL
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: The value of the parameter named in PARAMNAME. Values that are lists are restricted to lists of single items of the same format type.

DataItem.Name: PDEATTRIBUTE
DataItem.Description: Selection from available PDE attributes whose values could be reported.

DataItem.Name: PDEATTRIBUTENAME
DataItem.Description: Selection from available PDE attributes that can be used to filter the PDE directory report.

DataItem.Name: PDEATTRIBUTEVALUE
DataItem.Description: Contains the value of the corresponding PDEATTRIBUTE in the appropriate format.

DataItem.Name: PDEREF
DataItem.Description: Contains the unique identifier of a PDE (uid) or of a PDE group (gid).

DataItem.Name: PDFLT
DataItem.AllowableFormats: Boolean, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Parameter Default Value.

DataItem.Name: PECACK
DataItem.Description: OK/NG response from the host to Pre-Exe Check event from equipment.

DataItem.Name: PECEACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the event.

DataItem.Name: PECRACK
DataItem.Description: Response component for single recipe check.

DataItem.Name: PEMFLAG
DataItem.Description: PEMFlag holds SecurityID to be used for PJ creation:

DataItem.Name: PFCD
DataItem.Description: Predefined form code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: PGRPACTION
DataItem.Description: The action to be performed on a port group.

DataItem.Name: PMAX
DataItem.Description: Parameter Count Maximum.

DataItem.Name: PNAME
DataItem.Description: Parameter Name ≤16 characters.

DataItem.Name: PORTACTION
DataItem.Description: The action to be performed on a port.

DataItem.Name: PORTGRPNAME
DataItem.Description: The identifier of a group of ports.

DataItem.Name: PPARM
DataItem.AllowableFormats: Boolean, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Process Parameter.

DataItem.Name: PPBODY
DataItem.Description: Process program body.

DataItem.Name: PPGNT
DataItem.Description: Process program grant status, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: PPID
DataItem.Description: Process program ID.

DataItem.Name: PRAXI
DataItem.Description: Process axis.

DataItem.Name: PRCMDNAME
DataItem.Description: Commands sent to a Process Job:

DataItem.Name: PRCPREEXECHK
DataItem.Description: Enable/Disable of PreExecution Check option. This defines use of optional Pre-Execution Check.

DataItem.Name: PRCSWITCH
DataItem.Description: Enable/Disable of entire PRC functionalities.

DataItem.Name: PRDCT
DataItem.Description: Process Die Count.

DataItem.Name: PREACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the event.

DataItem.Name: PREVENTID
DataItem.Description: Processing related event identification:

DataItem.Name: PRJOBID
DataItem.Description: Text string which uniquely identifies a Process Job.

DataItem.Name: PRJOBMILESTONE
DataItem.Description: Notification of Processing status shall have one of the following values:

DataItem.Name: PRJOBSPACE
DataItem.Description: The number of Process Jobs that can be created.

DataItem.Name: PRMTRLORDER
DataItem.Description: Defines the order by which material in the Process Jobs material list will be processed. Possible values are assigned as follows:

DataItem.Name: PRPAUSEEVENT
DataItem.Description: The list of event identifiers, which may be sent as an attribute value to a Process Job. When a Process Job encounters one of these events it will pause, until it receives the PRJobCommand RESUME.

DataItem.Name: PRPROCESSSTART
DataItem.Description: Indicates that the process resource start processing immediately when ready:

DataItem.Name: PRRECIPEMETHOD
DataItem.Description: Indicates the recipe specification type, whether tuning is applied and which method is used:

DataItem.Name: PRSTATE
DataItem.Description: Enumerated value, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: PRXACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: PSRACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: PTN
DataItem.Description: Material Port number, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: QREACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the event.

DataItem.Name: QRXACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: QRXLEACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the event.

DataItem.Name: QUA
DataItem.Description: Quantity in format, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: RAC
DataItem.Description: Reset acknowledge, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: RACSWITCH
DataItem.Description: Enable/Disable of entire RAC functionalities.

DataItem.Name: RCMD
DataItem.Description: Remote command code or string.

DataItem.Name: RCPBODYA
DataItem.Description: Recipe body allowed list structure.

DataItem.Name: RCPATTRDATA
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: The contents (value) of a recipe attribute.

DataItem.Name: RCPATTRID
DataItem.Description: The name (identifier) of a non-identifier recipe attribute.

DataItem.Name: RCPBODY
DataItem.Description: Recipe body.

DataItem.Name: RCPCLASS
DataItem.Description: Recipe class.

DataItem.Name: RCPCMD
DataItem.Description: Indicates an action to be performed on a recipe.

DataItem.Name: RCPDESCLTH
DataItem.Description: The length in bytes of a recipe section.

DataItem.Name: RCPDESCNM
DataItem.Description: Identifies a type of descriptor of a recipe: ‘ASDesc’, ‘BodyDesc’, ‘GenDesc.’

DataItem.Name: RCPDESCTIME
DataItem.Description: The timestamp of a recipe section, in the format ‘YYYYMMDDhhmmsscc.’

DataItem.Name: RCPID
DataItem.Description: Recipe identifier. Formatted text conforming to the requirements of OBJSPEC.

DataItem.Name: RCPNAME
DataItem.Description: Recipe name.

DataItem.Name: RCPNEWID
DataItem.Description: The new recipe identifier assigned as the result of a copy or rename operation.

DataItem.Name: RCPOWCODE
DataItem.Description: Indicates whether any preexisting recipe is to be overwritten (= TRUE) or not (= FALSE) on download.

DataItem.Name: RCPPARNM
DataItem.Description: The name of a recipe variable parameter. Maximum length of 256 characters.

DataItem.Name: RCPPARRULE
DataItem.Description: The restrictions applied to a recipe variable parameter setting. Maximum length of 80 characters.

DataItem.Name: RCPPARVAL
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: The initial setting assigned to a recipe variable parameter. Text form restricted to maximum of 80 characters.

DataItem.Name: RCPRENAME
DataItem.Description: Indicates whether a recipe is to be renamed (= TRUE) or copied (= FALSE).

DataItem.Name: RCPSECCODE
DataItem.Description: Indicates the sections of a recipe requested for transfer or being transferred:

DataItem.Name: RCPSECNM
DataItem.Description: Recipe section name: ‘Generic’, ‘Body’, or ‘ASDS.’

DataItem.Name: RCPSPEC
DataItem.Description: Recipe specifier. The object specifier of a recipe.

DataItem.Name: RCPSTAT
DataItem.Description: The status of a managed recipe.

DataItem.Name: RCPUPDT
DataItem.Description: Indicates if an existing recipe is to be updated (= True) or a new recipe is to be created (= False).

DataItem.Name: RCPVERS
DataItem.Description: Recipe version.

DataItem.Name: READLN
DataItem.Description: Maximum length to read.

DataItem.Name: RecID
DataItem.Description: RCPSPEC' or 'PPID' RecID may not always be a unique identifier.

DataItem.Name: RECLEN
DataItem.Description: Maximum length of a Discrete record.

DataItem.Name: REFP
DataItem.Description: Reference Point.

DataItem.Name: REPGSZ
DataItem.Description: Reporting group size.

DataItem.Name: RESC
DataItem.Description: Resolution code for numeric data.

DataItem.Name: RESOLUTION
DataItem.Description: Contains the unique identifier of a PDE (uid).

DataItem.Name: RESPDESTAT
DataItem.Description: Status response for the Resolve PDE request. If more than one of these conditions applies, the first value on the list that applies should be returned.

DataItem.Name: RESPEC
DataItem.Description: Object specifier for the recipe executor.

DataItem.Name: RESV
DataItem.Description: Resolution value for numeric data.

DataItem.Name: RETICLEID
DataItem.Description: The object identifier for a reticle. Conforms to OBJSPEC.

DataItem.Name: RETPLACEINSTR
DataItem.Description: Instructions to indicate which pod slots will have reticles placed. Possible values for Reticle-PlacementInstruction are:

DataItem.Name: RETREMOVEINSTR
DataItem.Description: Instructions to indicate which pod slots will have reticles removed.

DataItem.Name: RIC
DataItem.Description: Reset code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: RMACK
DataItem.Description: Conveys whether a requested action was successfully completed, denied, completed with errors, or will be completed with notification to the requestor.

DataItem.Name: RMCHGSTAT
DataItem.Description: Indicates the change that occurred for an object.

DataItem.Name: RMCHGTYPE
DataItem.Description: Indicates the type of change for a recipe.

DataItem.Name: RMDATASIZE
DataItem.Description: The maximum total length, in bytes, of a multi-block message, used by the receiver to determine if the anticipated message exceeds the receiver’s capacity.

DataItem.Name: RMGRNT
DataItem.Description: Grant code, used to grant or deny a request. 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: RMNEWNS
DataItem.Description: New name (identifier) assigned to a recipe namespace.

DataItem.Name: RMNSCMD
DataItem.Description: Action to be performed on a recipe namespace.

DataItem.Name: RMNSSPEC
DataItem.Description: The object specifier of a recipe namespace.

DataItem.Name: RMRECSPEC
DataItem.Description: The object specifier of a distributed recipe namespace recorder.

DataItem.Name: RMREQUESTOR
DataItem.Description: Set to TRUE if initiator of change request was an attached segment. Set to FALSE otherwise.

DataItem.Name: RMSEGSPEC
DataItem.Description: The object specifier of a distributed recipe namespace segment.

DataItem.Name: RMSPACE
DataItem.Description: The amount of storage available for at least one recipe in a recipe namespace, in bytes.

DataItem.Name: ROWCT
DataItem.Description: Row count in die increments.

DataItem.Name: RPMACK
DataItem.Description: Reticle Pod management service acknowledge code. 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: RPMDESTLOC
DataItem.Description: The LocationID towards which a reticle must be moved. Conforms to OBJID.

DataItem.Name: RPMSOURLOC
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: The LocationID of the location from which to pick-up a reticle for moving it to another location. Conforms to OBJID.

DataItem.Name: RPSEL
DataItem.Description: Reference Point Select.

DataItem.Name: RPTID
DataItem.Description: Report ID.

DataItem.Name: RPTOC
DataItem.Description: A Trace Object attribute for a flag which, if set TRUE, causes only variables which have changed during the sample period to be included in a report.

DataItem.Name: RQCMD
DataItem.Description: Required Command.

DataItem.Name: RQPAR
DataItem.Description: Required Parameter.

DataItem.Name: RRACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: RSACK
DataItem.Description: Ready to Send Acknowledge code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: RSDA
DataItem.Description: Request Spool Data Acknowledge.

DataItem.Name: RSDC
DataItem.Description: Request Spool Data Code.

DataItem.Name: RSINF
DataItem.Description: Starting location for row or column. This item consists of 3 values (x,y,direction). If direction value is negative, it equals decreasing direction. If the value is positive, it equals increasing direction. Direction must be a nonzero value.

DataItem.Name: RSPACK
DataItem.Description: Reset Spooling Acknowledge.

DataItem.Name: RTSRSPSTAT
DataItem.Description: Status response for the Ready To Send request.

DataItem.Name: RTYPE
DataItem.Description: Type of record.

DataItem.Name: RXACK
DataItem.Description: Response component for a list of recipe transfer.

DataItem.Name: SDACK
DataItem.Description: Map set-up data acknowledge.

DataItem.Name: SDBIN
DataItem.Description: Send bin information flag.

DataItem.Name: SECID
DataItem.Description: Identifier of Security Class of the recipe.

DataItem.Name: SENDRESULT
DataItem.Description: Reports overall success or failure of the sendPDE() request.

DataItem.Name: SENDRSPSTAT
DataItem.Description: Status response for the Send PDE request.

DataItem.Name: SEQNUM
DataItem.Description: Command Number.

DataItem.Name: SFCD
DataItem.Description: Status form code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: SHEAD
DataItem.Description: Stored header related to the transaction timer.

DataItem.Name: SLOTID
DataItem.Description: Used to reference material by slot (a position that holds material/substrates) in a carrier. This item may be implemented as an array in some messages.

DataItem.Name: SMPLN
DataItem.Description: Sample number

DataItem.Name: SOFTREV
DataItem.Description: Software revision code 20 bytes maximum.

DataItem.Name: SPAACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: SPD
DataItem.Description: Service program data.

DataItem.Name: SPFACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: SPID
DataItem.Description: Service program ID, 6 characters.

DataItem.Name: SPNAME
DataItem.Description: Service parameter name defined in specific standard. If service parameter is defined as an object attribute, this is completely the same as ATTRID except format restrictions above.

DataItem.Name: SPR
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Service program results.

DataItem.Name: SPVAL
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Service parameter value, corresponding to SPNAME. If service parameter is defined as an object attribute, this is completely the same as ATTRDATA except format restrictions for the attribute.

DataItem.Name: SRAACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: SRSSWITCH
DataItem.Description: Enable/Disable entire SRS functionalities. Default is Disabled.

DataItem.Name: SSACK
DataItem.Description: Indicates the success or failure of a requested action. Two characters.

DataItem.Name: SSCMD
DataItem.Description: Indicates an action to be performed by the subsystem.

DataItem.Name: SSSACK
DataItem.Description: Information concerning the result of the service.

DataItem.Name: STATUS
DataItem.Description: Provides status information for a subsystem component. Used in the data item STATUSLIST.

DataItem.Name: STATUSLIST
DataItem.Description: A list of STATUS data sent in a fixed order. STATUSLIST has the following form:

DataItem.Name: STATUSTXT
DataItem.Description: Text string describing the corresponding status response. Maximum length of 80 characters.

DataItem.Name: STEMP
DataItem.Description: String template. ASCII text string acceptable to equipment as a parameter value. A data string matches a template string if the data string is at least as long as the template and each character of the data string matches the corresponding character of the template. A null list indicates all user data is acceptable to the machine.

DataItem.Name: STIME
DataItem.Description: Sample time, 12, 16 bytes, or Extended format as specified by the TimeFormat equipment constant value setting.

DataItem.Name: STRACK
DataItem.Description: Spool Stream Acknowledge.

DataItem.Name: STRID
DataItem.Description: Stream Identification.

DataItem.Name: STRP
DataItem.Description: Starting position in die coordinate position. Must be in (X,Y) order.

DataItem.Name: SV
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Status variable value.

DataItem.Name: SVCACK
DataItem.Description: Service acceptance acknowledge code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: SVCNAME
DataItem.Description: Service name provided on specified object asking by the host.

DataItem.Name: SVID
DataItem.Description: Status variable ID.

DataItem.Name: SVNAME
DataItem.Description: Status Variable Name.

DataItem.Name: TARGETID
DataItem.Description: Identifies where a request for action or data is to be applied. If text, conforms to OBJSPEC.

DataItem.Name: TARGETPDE
DataItem.Description: Contains the unique identifier (uid) of the PDE that is the starting point for the verification process.

DataItem.Name: TARGETSPEC
DataItem.Description: Object specifier of target object.

DataItem.Name: TBLACK
DataItem.Description: Indicates success or failure.

DataItem.Name: TBLCMD
DataItem.Description: Provides information about the table or parts of the table being transferred or requested. Enumerated:

DataItem.Name: TBLELT
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Table element. The first table element in a row is used to identify the row.

DataItem.Name: TBLID
DataItem.Description: Table identifier. Text conforming to the requirements of OBJSPEC.

DataItem.Name: TBLTYP
DataItem.Description: A reserved text string to denote the format and application of the table. Text conforming to the requirements of OBJSPEC.

DataItem.Name: TCID
DataItem.Description: TCID is the identifier of the TransferContainer.

DataItem.Name: TEXT
DataItem.Description: A single line of characters.

DataItem.Name: TIAACK
DataItem.Description: Equipment acknowledgement code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: TIACK
DataItem.Description: Time Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: TID
DataItem.Description: Terminal number, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: TIME
DataItem.Description: Time of day, 12, 16 bytes, or Extended format as specified by the TimeFormat equipment constant value setting.

DataItem.Name: TIMESTAMP
DataItem.Description: Timestamp in 12, 16 bytes, or Extended format indicating the time of an event, which encodes time as specified by the TimeFormat equipment constant value setting.

DataItem.Name: TOTSMP
DataItem.Description: Total samples to be made.

DataItem.Name: TRACK
DataItem.Description: Tells whether the related transfer activity was successful (= True) or unsuccessful (= False).

DataItem.Name: TRANSFERSIZE
DataItem.Description: Size, in bytes, of the TransferContainer proposed for transfer.

DataItem.Name: TRATOMICID
DataItem.Description: Equipment assigned identifier for an atomic transfer.

DataItem.Name: TRAUTOD
DataItem.Description: A Trace Object attribute for a control flag which, if set TRUE, causes the Trace Object to delete itself when it has completed a report.

DataItem.Name: TRAUTOSTART
DataItem.Description: For each atomic transfer, this data item tells the equipment if it should automatically start the handoff when ready (= TRUE) or await the host’s ‘StartHandoff’ command (= FALSE) following setup. This data item only affects the primary transfer partner.

DataItem.Name: TRCMDNAME
DataItem.Description: Identifier of the transfer job-related command to be executed. Possible values:

DataItem.Name: TRDIR
DataItem.Description: Direction of handoff.

DataItem.Name: TRID
DataItem.Description: Trace request ID.

DataItem.Name: TRJOBID
DataItem.Description: Equipment assigned identifier for the transfer job.

DataItem.Name: TRJOBMS
DataItem.Description: Milestone for a transfer job (e.g., started or complete).

DataItem.Name: TRJOBNAME
DataItem.Description: Host assigned identifier for the transfer job. Limited to a maximum of 80 characters.

DataItem.Name: TRLINK
DataItem.Description: Common identifier for the atomic transfer used by the transfer partners to confirm that they are working on the same host-defined task.

DataItem.Name: TRLOCATION
DataItem.Description: Identifier of the material location involved with the transfer. For one transfer partner, this will represent the designated source location for the material to be sent. For the other transfer partner, it will represent the designated destination location for the material to be received.

DataItem.Name: TROBJNAME
DataItem.Description: Identifier for the material (transfer object) to be transferred.

DataItem.Name: TROBJTYPE
DataItem.Description: Type of object to be transferred.

DataItem.Name: TRPORT
DataItem.Description: Identifier of the equipment port to be used for the handoff.

DataItem.Name: TRPTNR
DataItem.Description: Name of the equipment which will serve as the other transfer partner for this atomic transfer. This corresponds to EQNAME.

DataItem.Name: TRPTPORT
DataItem.Description: Identifier of the transfer partner’s port to be used for the transfer.

DataItem.Name: TRRCP
DataItem.Description: Name of the transfer recipe for this handoff. Limited to a maximum of 80 characters.

DataItem.Name: TRROLE
DataItem.Description: Tells whether the equipment is to be the primary or secondary transfer partner.

DataItem.Name: TRSPER
DataItem.Description: A Trace Object attribute which holds the value for sampling interval time.

DataItem.Name: TRTYPE
DataItem.Description: Tells whether the equipment is to be an active or passive participant in the transfer.

DataItem.Name: TSIP
DataItem.Description: Transfer status of input port, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: TSOP
DataItem.Description: Transfer status of output port, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: TTC
DataItem.Description: Time to completion.

DataItem.Name: TYPEID
DataItem.Description: Identifier of the Type of the recipe.

DataItem.Name: UID
DataItem.Description: Contains a unique identifier for a PDE.

DataItem.Name: ULIM
DataItem.Description: Upper limit for numeric value.

DataItem.Name: UNFLEN
DataItem.Description: Unformatted Process Program Length.

DataItem.Name: UNITS
DataItem.Description: Units Identifier.

DataItem.Name: UPPERDB
DataItem.AllowableFormats: Boolean, A, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: A variable limit attribute which defines the upper boundary of the deadband of a limit. The value applies to a single limit (LIMITID) for a specified VID. Thus, UPPERDB and LOWERDB as a pair define a limit.

DataItem.Name: V
DataItem.AllowableFormats: L, B, Boolean, A, J, I1, I2, I4, I8, F4, F8, U1, U2, U4, U8
DataItem.Description: Variable data.

DataItem.Name: VERID
DataItem.Description: Optional unique identifier of recipes.

DataItem.Name: VERIFYDEPTH
DataItem.Description: Selects whether to check only the target PDE or all associated PDEs within a multi-part recipe.

DataItem.Name: VERIFYRSPSTAT
DataItem.Description: Verification result.

DataItem.Name: VERIFYTYPE
DataItem.Description: Choice of the type of verification to perform.

DataItem.Name: VID
DataItem.Description: Variable ID.

DataItem.Name: VLAACK
DataItem.Description: Variable Limit Attribute Acknowledge Code, 1 byte.

DataItem.Name: XDIES
DataItem.Description: X-axis die size (index).

DataItem.Name: XYPOS
DataItem.Description: X and Y Coordinate Position. Must be in (X,Y) order.

DataItem.Name: YDIES
DataItem.Description: Y-axis die size (index).
